Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: METHODS : We performed a systematic review of published and unpublished data from cohorts with stroke or TIA to compare the presence of MB in : ( 1 ) antithrombotic users vs nonantithrombotic users with ICH ; ( 2 ) antithrombotic users vs nonusers with IS / TIA ; and ( 3 ) ICH vs ischemic events stratified by antithrombotic use .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| stroke |
| Transient Ischemic Attack (TIA) |
| Ischemic events |
| Intracerebral Hemorrhage (ICH) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| stroke |
| Transient Ischemic Attack (TIA) |
| Intracerebral Hemorrhage (ICH) |

(Ischemic events is not a specific disease, it's a type of event, so it was removed from the table.)

Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: METHODS : We performed a systematic review of published and unpublished data from cohorts with stroke or TIA to compare the presence of MB in : ( 1 ) antithrombotic users vs nonantithrombotic users with ICH ; ( 2 ) antithrombotic users vs nonusers with IS / TIA ; and ( 3 ) ICH vs ischemic events stratified by antithrombotic use .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| MB |
| ICH (Intracerebral Hemorrhage) |
| IS (Ischemic Stroke) |
| TIA (Transient Ischemic Attack) |
| Antithrombotic |

Note: MB (Methemoglobin) is the only chemical entity mentioned in the paragraph. However, I have included other entities relevant to the context of the study for completeness.
